intro: Draba nivalis f. unalaschkensis, commonly known as the Alaska rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subarctic regions, particularly in the Arctic and subarctic areas of North America. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky and gravelly soils, often found in tundra and mountainous environments. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of the plant communities in its native range.
